title: Men’s Wear Puts on the Dog
text: A pavilion dedicated to the multibillion-dollar market in pet apparel makes its debut at the world’s largest men’s wear trade show.

title: New York Bans Pet Stores From Selling Dogs, Cats and Rabbits
text: The ban, which takes effect in December 2024, is meant to prevent the sale of animals raised by commercial breeders accused of keeping them in inhumane conditions.

title: How One Ukrainian Company Survived, and Thrived, Through a Year of War
text: For Kormotech and its 1,300 employees, Russia’s invasion disrupted everything. After nimble decision-making and good fortune, sales are up, providing Ukraine with much-needed tax revenue.

title: For Ukraine’s Animals, a Home Is Getting Harder to Find
text: Early in the war, thousands of pets were ferried out of danger, mostly to other European countries. But now adoptions are waning.

title: Nausea, Wobbling, Confusion: Dogs Are Getting Sick From Discarded Weed
text: In places where recreational use is legal, dogs are getting sick from eating the remains of joints and other cannabis products, veterinarians and poison-control centers say.

title: Our Relatives Keep Bringing Their Dog Over. How Can We Stop Them?
text: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on how to tell loved ones that you don’t love their pet.

title: The Days of Doggies in the Window Are Numbered
text: New York State is banning pet shops from selling dogs, cats and rabbits, starting in 2024, in an effort to crack down on “puppy mills.”

title: ‘DC League of Super-Pets’ Review: #ReleaseTheLassieCut
text: Dwayne Johnson and Kevin Hart voice canine heroes in a family-friendly animated spinoff of the “Justice League” franchise.

title: Pets Have Put On Pandemic Weight, Too
text: Humans weren't the only ones who gained weight during lockdown.

title: Pope Scolds Couples Who Choose Pets Over Kids
text: Expressing concern about global birthrates, Francis said such couples were acting in a selfish way that diminished humanity.

title: The South End of Stamford, Conn.: Master-Planned With Luxury Rentals, and Lots of Pets
text: The neighborhood, a 322-acre peninsula on Long Island Sound, has been redeveloped with 4,000 new apartments. And there are more to come.

title: Ukrainian refugees find shelter, and a hearty welcome for their pets, in Romania.
text: Viktor and Rachel Borovic had only two hours to prepare to flee their city. But they were clear about what was important to them.

title: Can My Condo Make Me Use the Service Elevator When I’m With My Dog?
text: Most apartment owners are subject to the house rules, which a board can change. But some rules are not always enforceable.

title: Polly Wants a Video Chat
text: Scientists let parrots call their parrot friends. Here’s what happened.

title: The Perfect Cooler for a Pint of Ice Cream
text: S’well has introduced a stainless steel container with a lid that keeps ice cream at the perfect scooping consistency.

title: Love Letter: Stranger Than ‘Sweetie’
text: Tell us about your weirdest terms of endearment.

title: You’ve Seen a Bodega Cat. How About a Barber Shop Rooster?
text: New York City’s beloved bodega cats are internet famous. But other animals — birds, snakes and even pigs — are also at home in neighborhood shops.

title: What New York Dog Owners Should Know About Leptospirosis
text: The Health Department did not confirm reports of an outbreak of the bacterial disease linked to McCarren Park, but said it was working with the Parks Department to keep out the rats that spread the illness.

title: China’s youth are disillusioned amid harsh zero-Covid policy enforcement.
text: Four years ago, many young Chinese liked to use the hashtag #Amazing China.

title: The Giant African Land Snail Has Been Spotted Again in Florida
text: Wash your lettuce.

title: ‘Human Factors’ Review: Paranoia is the Family Business
text: This thriller, about the invasion of a fractured home, is elevated by a talented cast but hampered by a stubbornly intellectual tone.

title: Nestlé suspends sales of KitKat and Nesquik Brands in Russia.
text: The consumer giant said it did not expect to make a profit in the country “for the foreseeable future.”

title: Falconry is an Ancient Sport. In Qatar, Drones Give it a Twist.
text: The training regimen now involves drones, but doomed pigeons are still in the mix. Generations of Qataris have taken up the hobby.

title: 5 Things to Do This Weekend
text: Selections from the Weekend section, including a review of boygenius's album "The Record."

title: A Paradise of Birds in Ghana’s Kakum National Park
text: Amid 145 square miles of rainforest, home to at least 266 bird species, all you can do is wait and watch.

title: A Time for War, a Time for Play
text: Summer for Ukraine’s children means sunshine and swimming, but also long hours in bomb shelters and mine-safety training. A photographer captured their days in Kyiv for The New York Times.

title: I Was Wrong About Mitt Romney (and His Dog)
text: Yes, he was boring. But there are some things much worse than boring.

title: Alligator Kills Florida Man Retrieving Frisbees in Lake, Officials Say
text: The 47-year-old man frequently swam into a lake near a disc golf course to retrieve stray discs and sell them, a park official said.

title: A Nod to Folklore
text: Experience the joy of Erik Agard’s Friday puzzle.

title: Challenge Accepted!
text: Brandon Koppy’s puzzle gets a little too personal.

title: My Partner Wants to Move His Parents Into Our House. Help!
text: Leery of a renovation plan to accommodate a partner’s aging parents, a reader considers pitching in to buy them a house of their own.

title: In Chernobyl’s Stray Dogs, Scientists Look for Genetic Effects of Radiation
text: A new study is the first step in an effort to understand how exposure to chronic, low-level radiation has affected the area’s dogs.

title: A Minimalist Australian Dream Home With an 18th-Century Twist
text: Why would a modernist house in a Melbourne suburb need an inverted ha-ha? (And what is a ha-ha, anyway?)

title: Do Eye Creams Actually Work for Wrinkles?
text: Look for a few key ingredients in skin care products if you want to deal with wrinkles — but no product will keep your face crease-free.

title: Congress Passed an $858 Billion Military Bill. Here’s What’s in It.
text: Lawmakers approved an 8 percent overall budget increase, funding for Taiwan and Ukraine, and a slew of provisions focused on judicial security and environmental protections.

title: What Do Stray Dogs Tell Us About the South?
text: A film about dogs conveys the complex reality behind the stories of neglect.
